page.title: 10A TYPICAL FAMILY SUNDAY
page.content: A typical Sunday means getting up at 6.30 a.m.for our family.We have breakfast then prepare a flask of hot cocoa and something to eat. We pick up our skate bags and get in the car, leaving at about 8.00 a.m. The journey to Bristol is about 25 miles.We get there at about 8.40 and have to wait until 9.00 a.m.My sister and I have a private ice-skating lesson and by the end our feet ache.The rest of the day we spend in the garden and riding our bikes.We play races and chase then we go in to tea. We have toasted cheese sandwiches, bread,butter and fruitcake.After tea we read a book, have a bath and then we go to bed. We go to church sometimes, especially if it is Harvest Festival, Christmas, a Christening or a Wedding.
